elements.title: Extended quantum anomalous Hall states in graphene/hBN moiré superlattices (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Extended quantum anomalous Hall states in graphene/hBN moiré superlattices

New topological states have been observed in rhombohedral graphene/hBN moiré superlattices, including fractional and extended quantum anomalous Hall effects, at ultra-low temperatures, demonstrating the rich quantum phenomena emerging from correlated electrons in topological flat bands.

  • Zhengguang Lu
  • Tonghang Han
  • Long Ju
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Resolving native GABAA receptor structures from the human brain (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Resolving native GABAA receptor structures from the human brain

Cryo-electron microscopy structures of native type A GABA receptors from human brain reveal diverse subunit compositions, protein binding partners and binding sites for antiepileptic drugs.

  • Jia Zhou
  • Colleen M. Noviello
  • Ryan E. Hibbs
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

Using multi-ancestry genome-wide association study and fine-mapping, 298 loci and 36 credible genes are identified in the aetiology of bipolar disorder.

  • Kevin S. O’Connell
  • Maria Koromina
  • Dan Siskind
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Experience-dependent dopamine modulation of male aggression (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Experience-dependent dopamine modulation of male aggression

Dopaminergic neurons in the ventral tegmental area have a role in modulating aggression in adult male mice, and this effect of dopamine depends strongly on fighting experience.

  • Bing Dai
  • Bingqin Zheng
  • Dayu Lin
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Superconductivity in 5.0° twisted bilayer WSe2 (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Superconductivity in 5.0° twisted bilayer WSe2

We report superconductivity, in a limited region of displacement field and density, in 5.0° twisted bilayer WSe2 with a maximum critical temperature of 426 mK, establishing that moiré flat-band superconductivity extends beyond graphene structures.

  • Yinjie Guo
  • Jordan Pack
  • Cory R. Dean
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Tissue-resident memory CD8 T cell diversity is spatiotemporally imprinted (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Tissue-resident memory CD8 T cell diversity is spatiotemporally imprinted

Profiling of the location and transcriptome of tissue-resident memory CD8 T cell formation at single-transcript resolution finds regionalized signalling as the basis of immune diversity in the intestine and provides a conceptual framework for the study of tissue immune networks.

  • Miguel Reina-Campos
  • Alexander Monell
  • Ananda W. Goldrath
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Field–particle energy transfer during chorus emissions in space (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Field–particle energy transfer during chorus emissions in space

Whistler-mode chorus waves have been observed in the tail region of the terrestrial magnetosphere, where the magnetic field is not dipolar so that chorus waves were not expected, and their generation mechanisms have been tested with state-of-the-art observations.

  • C. M. Liu
  • B. N. Zhao
  • J. L. Burch
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Global 3D model of mantle attenuation using seismic normal modes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Global 3D model of mantle attenuation using seismic normal modes

Using whole-Earth oscillations to constrain a 3D global model of attenuation for the whole mantle, low attenuation correlates with low velocity in the lower mantle, suggesting long-lived deep-mantle provinces.

  • Sujania Talavera-Soza
  • Laura Cobden
  • Arwen Deuss
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: The maternal X chromosome affects cognition and brain ageing in female mice (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The maternal X chromosome affects cognition and brain ageing in female mice

The maternal X chromosome in female mice impairs cognition through the silencing of certain genes and accelerates ageing of the hippocampus.

  • Samira Abdulai-Saiku
  • Shweta Gupta
  • Dena B. Dubal
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: RELMβ sets the threshold for microbiome-dependent oral tolerance (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
RELMβ sets the threshold for microbiome-dependent oral tolerance

RELMβ mediates a gut immune–epithelial circuit regulating tolerance to food antigens, offering targetable candidates for the prevention and treatment of food allergies.

  • Emmanuel Stephen-Victor
  • Gavin A. Kuziel
  • Talal A. Chatila
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: A map of the rubisco biochemical landscape (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A map of the rubisco biochemical landscape

A massively parallel assay developed to map the essential photosynthetic enzyme rubisco showed that non-trivial biochemical changes and improvements in CO2 affinity are possible, signposting further enzyme engineering efforts to increase crop yields.

  • Noam Prywes
  • Naiya R. Phillips
  • David F. Savage
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Precise modelling of mitochondrial diseases using optimized mitoBEs (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Precise modelling of mitochondrial diseases using optimized mitoBEs

A study reports optimized mitochondrial base editors with reduced off-target effects to facilitate the generation of mouse models of human mitochondrial diseases.

  • Xiaoxue Zhang
  • Xue Zhang
  • Wensheng Wei
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Multiscale footprints reveal the organization of cis-regulatory elements (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Multiscale footprints reveal the organization of cis-regulatory elements

We developed PRINT, a computational method that identifies footprints of DNA–protein interactions from bulk and single-cell chromatin accessibility data across multiple scales of protein size.

  • Yan Hu
  • Max A. Horlbeck
  • Jason D. Buenrostro
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Rapid and scalable personalized ASO screening in patient-derived organoids (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Rapid and scalable personalized ASO screening in patient-derived organoids

A scalable platform for generating patient-specific organoids for testing personalized oligonucleotide therapeutics is described.

  • John C. Means
  • Anabel L. Martinez-Bengochea
  • Scott T. Younger
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Leveraging a phased pangenome for haplotype design of hybrid potato (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Leveraging a phased pangenome for haplotype design of hybrid potato

A phased pangenome of potato constructed from 60 wild and cultivated haplotypes shows that substantial hybridization occurred during domestication and enables identification of many putative deleterious variants, providing a basis for the design of improved inbred lines.

  • Lin Cheng
  • Nan Wang
  • Sanwen Huang
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Immune evasion through mitochondrial transfer in the tumour microenvironment (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Immune evasion through mitochondrial transfer in the tumour microenvironment

Mitochondria with mutations in their DNA from cancer cells can be transferred to T cells in the tumour microenvironment, which leads to T cell dysfunction and impaired antitumour immunity.

  • Hideki Ikeda
  • Katsushige Kawase
  • Yosuke Togashi
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Complete human recombination maps (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Complete human recombination maps

Complete human recombination maps are presented that enable exploration of both cross-over and non-cross-over events during meiosis, with the potential to provide insight into the causes of aneuploidies and pregnancy loss.

  • Gunnar Palsson
  • Marteinn T. Hardarson
  • Kari Stefansson
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Synthesis of a semimetallic Weyl ferromagnet with point Fermi surface (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Synthesis of a semimetallic Weyl ferromagnet with point Fermi surface

Van der Waals (Cr,Bi)2Te3, synthesized by non-equilibrium molecular beam epitaxy, is characterized by magnetotransport measurements and shown to be a semimetallic Weyl ferromagnet, with Fermi surface composed of two Weyl points and no irrelevant electronic states.

  • Ilya Belopolski
  • Ryota Watanabe
  • Yoshinori Tokura
Article22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Mapping cells through time and space with moscot (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Mapping cells through time and space with moscot

Moscot is an optimal transport approach that overcomes current limitations of similar methods to enable multimodal, scalable and consistent single-cell analyses of datasets across spatial and temporal dimensions.

  • Dominik Klein
  • Giovanni Palla
  • Fabian J. Theis
ArticleOpen Access22 Jan 2025

elements.title: Ultrabroadband integrated electro-optic frequency comb in lithium tantalate (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Ultrabroadband integrated electro-optic frequency comb in lithium tantalate

An integrated electro-optic frequency comb that combines microwave integrated circuits with a photonic circuit based on lithium tantalate leads to broadband operation with low power requirements.

  • Junyin Zhang
  • Chengli Wang
  • Tobias J. Kippenberg
Article22 Jan 2025
